content.description: A short, off-vertical line with 2 bolts.
content.protection: 2 bolts, or boulder it with pads
content.location: From the fire pit, walk south through the corridor and it will be just ahead of you on the north facing wall

content.description: Thin face climb with a flake on the right side. Passes a small 1ft roof at the second bolt.
content.protection: 3 bolts and anchors. Hardware replaced in Feb 2021 thanks to the ASCA (safeclimbing.org)

content.description: A striking sharp arete beckons as soon as you walk up to the main area. Starts sitting in obvious flat jugs. Uses a variety of holds and interesting positions to climb straight up the blade. This name is a placeholder name. Please message me if you know the original name.
content.location: Walking into the main city of rock in Little Germany it should be immediately on the left guarding a thin corridor.

content.description: A lowball, sharp, and dabby boulder. Start on flat jugs under the roof, same as Mythril, but traverse straight right and around the corner staying low to the ground. Avoid dabbing on a scary blade of a boulder. Pull a series of awkward moves using sharp crimps to establish on the face and top out. An unpleasant turd of a boulder but a challenge.
content.location: On the Mythril block 500ft east of the main Little Germany area and by itself.

content.description: Optional overhanging boulder start on the sharktooth located inside the overhang. Stand on boulder underneath and smear feet against slabby interior wall, reach out with your left hand into a crack with a nice jam, bring your knee into a lock adjecent your left hand and reach with your right out of the cave and to the top of the crack right is jamned in(Crux). Finally move to the jug (pictured) and cut feet, match healhook to right hand and move left hand either into finger crack or small pocket above, find a right hand pocket and pull over(crux 2)(optional jump start begins here). Find your way up a series of finger cracks on the face moving to the second bolt. A series of side pulls, horizontal and offwidth cracks lead to the final bolt.
content.protection: Three bolts and anchors. Crash pad for cave start. Pole to clip first bolt and protect start.Hardware replaced in Feb 2021 thanks to the ASCA (safeclimbing.org)

content.description: A Tulsa area classic. Start underneath the roof on flat jug and climb straight out the prow.
content.location: All by itself to the right of the main trail coming in to little germ

content.description: A striking, well protected face climb with an interesting start.
content.protection: 3 bolts and anchors. Hardware replaced in Feb 2021 thanks to the ASCA (safeclimbing.org)
content.location: Just on the right side of the arete from Sharptooth

content.description: A great, slightly low-angle, climb to activate your lead head or to learn how to lead. For best results, Hangout around the arête. Climbing on the left side of the bolts will leave you fighting with vines.
content.protection: Two bolts plus a two bolt anchor with chains. Bolts installed 2020.
content.location: Directly west from Sharptooth on a taller south facing wall.

content.description: Nice climb with a crack that opens a few times for fingers. A tricky start that leans right with smeared feet. Can get a bit wet at times.
content.protection: Top rope, trad, no bolts or anchors.
content.location: On the north east end of the corridor at Little Germany facing north. Near the bolted routes over the big roof.

content.description: Start on the same hold as Mithril and traverse out to the left a few moves. Throw for a small pocket to the left of the big crack and continue straight up over the lip for a fairly easy top out.
content.location: left side of the Mithril overhang.

content.description: starting at the north end of the first wall you come to. knee high foot position to get up the hump. climb the arete up to good holds then moving right with the cracks. big flake out a few feet and move up into what could be the crux. weird holds to get you up and to the top.
content.location: up the hill on avery drive. first wall you come to on the hill. on your right, then you follow left to the rest of the rocks. climb starts at north end of rock. small roof and some sloping finger cracks. weird hump on the arete. easy walk off the back side.

content.description: A short but fun compression block. Start on flat jugs under the roof, same as Mythril, but move left through a couple of powerful compression moves and top out. Slightly beta intensive and can be either very powerful or reasonable depending on the beta.
content.location: On the Mythril block. This boulder is east and detached from the main Little Germany area.

content.description: This is the first main area you will come to after passing Chandler Park. A lot of shade, not a whole lot of traffic, atv trails nearby. Little Germany will be on your left opposite the Arkansas River on your right. Approx. 2 miles west of Chandler Park entrance on Avery Drive there should be a big pull-off / parking area on the left (south) side of the road just before the fenced utility station. Little Germany will be approx. 3/10 of a mile past this pull-off / parking area.
